name: Waldorf Astoria Shanghai on the Bund

reviews.title: Luxury at its best
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for four nights on business. It was the second time I have stayed at the hotel and it just gets better. The rooms are big with all the amenities that anyone would require. Fresh fruit everyday and very friendly staff. Room service is fantastic and laundry service is fast. The hotel is like an oasis but still gives you the Shanghai feeling.

I stayed at this hotel for two nights, The service was more then GREAT check in and check out took only minutes the staff seemed to anticipate all your needs and were happy to serve, The common spaces of this hotel are beautiful the rooms are big and extremely well equipped, the was heavenly, in short a perfect hotel.
reviews.title: A truly amazing experiance!

reviews.text: The surrounding area of the hotel is very nice there is a nice promenade along the river across the street of the hotel, where you can take a boat ride, the view from the hotel window is breathtaking,
reviews.title: Mixed feelings - excells in some areas, major misses in others

reviews.text: Will definitely come back to this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, service so so

reviews.text: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel. Im usually a Park Hyatt or Four Seasons fan, but was in the hotel for an event. The rooms are very comfortable and well appointed with all the automatd blinds and heated self flushing toilets one would expect in Asia. The food is pretty good - though i have had better breakfast buffets. The fluffy slippers would get a 5 star rating ! The housekeeping / room servicing was great and the concierge very helpful. I had a major disaster with the laundry. They ruined an expensive evening gown, then when trying to rectify the situation actually made it even worse by creating stains tht were not present before. This can happen, howver in 5 star hotel you expect more care. The way that the management then dealt with this issue compounded my disappointment as it was a clear attempt to side step responsibility and to try to put the blame on the guest. Not elegant at all - frankly cheap and superficial behaviour that left a sour taste
reviews.title: Waldorf Shanghai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is by far the one of the nicest hotel I have stayed in. The room was perfect, every detail had been thought of! The longer we stayed the more gadgets we discovered! (Secret mirror tv/electronic toilet/remote control curtains/etc). The room was beautifully decorated and the beds unbelievably comfy. The facilities were good to - lovely pool and gym. My only comment would be about the gym being too warm.
reviews.title: Perfect....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location right in the bund and helpful staff. Definitely worthy of being number on trip advisor.
reviews.title: One of the best of all time

reviews.text: I travel quite a bit, both internationally and domestically, and the Shanghai Waldorf is easily in the top 5 of hotels I have ever stayed in, probably top 3, and maybe even #1.
reviews.title: Waldorf

reviews.text: First off the hotel is in a great location in Shanghai. Right on the Bund, you can get to anything by walking or taking a short taxi. And I mean everything. Shopping, food, tourist sites, it is all close.
reviews.title: Not as good as it should have been.
Long Bar is great for a drink
reviews.text: Now, the hotel. Waldorf is one of those names where you expect luxury, and they do not disappoint. Hotel is all marble inside, with the downstairs as the main restaurant/breakfast buffet, and the upstairs check in and a few smaller bars and restaurants. I recommend the Long Bar, great drinks, very good food, especially the beef. Breakfast buffet was excellent as well.

We stayed at the WA on the end of 10 day cruise. (June 18-20th) Had we stayed in this hotel at the beginning of our trip, we probably would have missed the cruise. The rooms were amazing! We had a River View room and the view was breathtaking. Looking at the Shanghai skyline at night was absolutely beautiful. The beds were so comfortable it was hard to get up. We ate breakfast at the restaurant downstairs, the food was delicious, the variety was fantastic. The service, the staff was the best I can only say if this is what the Waldorf is all about I will definitely be staying in a Waldorf Astoria again. I have never written a review about anything but I was so impressed with this hotel, i just had to say something about it.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We lived in China for 5-6 years, and when we finally decided to move to Denmark, we decided to spend our last night in this hotel. The location was perfect by the bund, the entrance was a bit confusing because we thought we just drove by the front of the bund, and I guessed they asked our driver to drive to the other side with our luggages. When we got into the room, wow impressive! Big comfy bed, some seating area by the window with nice view of the bund, big bathroom with separate small room for toilet and shower, with a screen behind the mirror, which we can listen to the music or even watch tv, which was one of the coolest amenity in this hotel. The room also have a small coat room where we can hang our jackets and keep all our suitcases. Everything about the room was perfect and in a very good quality.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: The breakfast was also extraordinary, not the normal type of hotel buffet breakfast. Yes, we took salads, breads, and drinks by the buffet, but the 'main course' we chose from the menu card (omelletes, egg benedicts, waffles, and some Chinese dishes) and the chef prepared them just for us and delivered to our table in a very nice plating.
reviews.title: Still the best 5 star hotel in China. No challengers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also got a complimentary champagne in their Long Bar, it was nice and cozy place to relax. So overall, we love this hotel, and it was the perfect last night in China for us, hopefully one day we can visit again!
reviews.title: A five star experience at a world class hotel

reviews.text: I have spent the last 10 years traveling China and the world with my husband who works in Beijing. I am in week 3 of a china trip. On the whole, the Chinese still do not understand the concept of service nor comfort. WA Shanghai shatters that perception with service par excellence. The rooms are opulent and spotless. The restaurants are excellent. The Long Bar Lounge is a must see. The location cannot be beaten even by a stay in the French Concession. But what truly sets this WA apart is the staff. Superb service, English speaking staff who actually take pride in their hotel - a rarity in China. Have just finished stays in Conrad Hong Kong, Conrad Sanya, Shangri La Hong Kong and St Regis Beijing. Will review all but had to start with the best.
reviews.title: 5 star luxury and 5 star staff/ BEST in Shanghai

reviews.text: This hotel is certainly top notch, as are its prices: very expensive. I thought I checked into the old Bund building, which was not the case. The taxi brought me to the back into a new building. Still beautiful, but far from the Bund itself. I could overlook the Bund and the rooms were very nice, but it was not 'on the Bund'. You walk downstairs and then reach the old building where the bar and restaurants are and then you enter the Bund. Still, the hotel is beautiful and I enjoyed it very much.
reviews.title: Location location - but not in the old building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are not that many Hotel (chains) that you can truly call Excellent in every aspect. The Walldorf Astoria is the exception.
reviews.title: Fantastic Excellent Hotel with an amazing view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is exceptional and very personal. The quality is of the highest standard and we must say, the view from our room was amazing; our room was on the 14th floor.
reviews.title: Stunning property, great location

reviews.text: There are all kinds of gadgets in the room, a window between bathroom and bedroom that can be changed from "milky glass" to "see through glass", a TV in the bathroom mirror and the automatic toilet is an experience on its own.
reviews.title: One of the best in the world!

reviews.text: Located in the Bund area this hotel boasts of the perfect location. The property is kept in mint condition. The staff is friendly and helpful- the concierge desk was very attentive to our needs. Breakfast was awesome- one could choose from a traditional English Breakfast with sausage and eggs or the traditional Chinese items. I loved the custard filled dumplings, they were soft and melt in your mouth. We had drinks at the famous Long Bar. My lychee martini was great but very pricey. This hotel is definitely in the luxury category. It is pricey but worth the price if you want to splurge, the other thing that impressed us was the fact that wi fi was free and so was the several bottles of water in the room. It is awful when hotels charge you a high price for the room and then nickel and dime you for the smaller stuff- my pet peeve.
reviews.title: Excellent

aka: Waldorf Astoria Shanghai On The Bund Hotel Shanghai
description: Combining the history and culture of the celebrated Shanghai Bund with a taste for 21st century sophistication, Waldorf Astoria Shanghai on the Bund offers a heritage ambiance, legendary service and timeless amenities to make your stay truly memorable and distinct. Housed within the two-building complex in phases are 260 well-appointed rooms and suites, stylish environments for dining and lounging, extensive banquet facilities with stunning views, luxury spa, fully-fitted gym ,free WiFi and more, all crafted onto a picture perfect setting that speaks volume of the grandeur and finesse that is uniquely ours.
